intro: Psychotria nummularioides var. pubiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered psychotria, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and often have a waxy texture, while the flowers are small and clustered in umbels. The variety 'pubiflora' is distinguished by its hairy inflorescences, which give it its common name.
